body.p: The following sections describe the format of the IPC messages used to communicate with flash interface.

section.title: FlashChannelConfigUpdate
section.p: This message is sent to update flash channel configuration information.

description.p: This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
Valid values for FlashChReq messages are zero through 253. Values outside this range are reserved.
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.
This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.
This field specifies the XOR calculator flow ID.
The value of this field is ignored when the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.
The XOR Calculator ID field is translated when processed by the XOR calculator. When received by a Flash channel processor, this field contains the XOR context ID.

note.p: This field is reserved for this request.

description.p: Last Request of a XOR Calculator Flow ID Stripe
This field indicates whether this is the last request of a Flow ID stripe.

ul.li: 0 (NOTLAST) First or middle operation of a Flow ID stripe
1 (LAST) Last operation of a Flow ID stripe

description.p: The value of this field is ignored then the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.

note.p: This field is reserved for this request.

description.p: This field encodes whether a XOR calculator operation is performed as a side effect of a request message processing.

note.p: This field is reserved for this request.

description.p: This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.
This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.

This field controls the Flash command value used for the flash program operation. 0 (p80h) Use a command value of 80H when performing the program operation. 1 (p81h) Use a command value of 81H when performing the program operation.
Number of contexts per flash channel.

section.title: FlashEccContextInfoUpdate
section.p: This message is sent to update flash ECC context information such as ECC chunk size and protected data size. This message will be repeated until ECC context data is provided for all ECC contexts.

description.p: This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
Valid values for FlashChReq messages are zero through 253. Values outside this range are reserved.
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.
This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.
This field specifies the XOR calculator flow ID.
The value of this field is ignored when the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.
The XOR Calculator ID field is translated when processed by the XOR calculator. When received by a Flash channel processor, this field contains the XOR context ID.

note.p: This field is reserved for this request.

description.p: Last Request of a XOR Calculator Flow ID Stripe
This field indicates whether this is the last request of a Flow ID stripe.

ul.li: 0 (NOTLAST) First or middle operation of a Flow ID stripe
1 (LAST) Last operation of a Flow ID stripe

description.p: The value of this field is ignored then the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.

note.p: This field is reserved for this request.

description.p: This field encodes whether a XOR calculator operation is performed as a side effect of a request message processing.

note.p: This field is reserved for this request.

description.p: This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.
This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.
Number of ECC Context Data entries.
This field indicates number of ECC context data entries are valid.
This field contain ECC context data such as context number, protected data size, and ECC chunk size.

This field contains ECC chunk size for given ECC context number

ProtectedDataSize
Protected Data Size.
This field contains protected data size for given ECC context number.

section.title: FlashTimingParamUpdate
section.p: This message is sent to update flash timing information.

description.p: This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
Valid values for FlashChReq messages are zero through 253. Values outside this range are reserved.
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.
This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.
This field specifies the XOR calculator flow ID.
The value of this field is ignored when the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.
The XOR Calculator ID field is translated when processed by the XOR calculator. When received by a Flash channel processor, this field contains the XOR context ID.

note.p: This field is reserved for this request.

description.p: Last Request of a XOR Calculator Flow ID Stripe
This field indicates whether this is the last request of a Flow ID stripe.

ul.li: 0 (NOTLAST) First or middle operation of a Flow ID stripe
1 (LAST) Last operation of a Flow ID stripe

description.p: The value of this field is ignored then the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.

note.p: This field is reserved for this request.

description.p: This field encodes whether a XOR calculator operation is performed as a side effect of a request message processing.

note.p: This field is reserved for this request.

description.p: This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.
This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.
This field specifies the dummy busy time (tDBSY) in units of Flash I/O clock cycles.
Change Column Setup Time To Data In/Out or Next Command
This field specifies the chane column setup time to data in/out or next command (tCCS) in units of Flash I/O clock cycles.
This field selects the Flash Timing (FT) register used for the Flash operations.

ul.li: 0 Timing mode 0 selects FT0xxx timing mode register values
1 Timing mode 1 selects FT1xxx timing mode register values

section.title: Dynamic IPC Message format.
section.p: Dynamic IPC message format is created to minimize number of IPC messages to be sent between firmware and flash interface. Dynamic message format operates on read/write headers. Each read/Write header provides details of operation to be performed such as number of buffer involved, number of ECC chunks involved, and etc.
section.title: ReadHeader
section.p: Read header is used for flash read operations. There will be one or more read headers to operate on single page (Refer usage example section for more details). Same read header is used for RAW mode flash read operations also.

description.p: Plane number of current read header. It may not be physical plane number. Microcode uses this field to get corresponding flash address provided in the flash read messages.
Number of buffers involved in current read header.
Last buffer spans to next plane.
Flag to indicate last buffer span to next plane.
Number of ECC chunks involved in current read header.
Starting ECC chunk number of current read header.
Number of DWords to be dumped in first ECC chunk (Starting ECC chunk) of current read header..

section.title: WriteHeader
section.p: Write header is used for flash write operations. There will be one write headers to operate on single page (Refer usage example section for more details). Same write header is used for RAW mode flash write operations also.

description.p: Plane number of current write header. It may not be physical plane number. Microcode uses this field to get corresponding flash address provided in the flash write messages.
Number of buffers involved in current write header.
Last buffer spans to next plane.
Flag to indicate last buffer span to next plane.
Number of ECC chunks involved in current write header.

body.section:
FlashReadThis message is used to send single-plane or multi-plane flash page read requests to the flash interface. The size of message is limited to 16 DWORDs and the format of the first two DWORDs is fixed for HW use. If there's more than 16 DWORDs of information, FlashCont message will be used. FlashRead
DWord
Position
Name
Description
0
7
0
msgType
Message type
This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
Valid values for FlashChReq messages are zero through 253. Values outside this range are reserved.
1 (Read) Flash Read
2 (Write) Flash Write
3 (Erase) Flash Block Erase
4 (Continue) Flash Continuous Request
5 (ChannelConfig) Flash Channel Configuration update
6 (ECCContextInfo) Flash ECC Context information update
7 (TimerParam) Flash Timing Parameter update
0

8

Flash Channel Queue
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.

This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.

This field specifies the XOR calculator flow ID.
The value of this field is ignored when the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.
The XOR Calculator ID field is translated when processed by the XOR calculator. When received by a Flash channel processor, this field contains the XOR context ID.
This field is reserved for flash read request.

30

Last Request of a XOR Calculator Flow ID Stripe
This field indicates whether this is the last request of a Flow ID stripe.
0 (NOTLAST) First or middle operation of a Flow ID stripe
1 (LAST) Last operation of a Flow ID stripe
The value of this field is ignored then the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.
This field is reserved for flash read request.

31
xorCalcOp
XOR Calculation Operation
This field encodes whether a XOR calculator operation is perform as a side effect of request message processing.
0 (NOP) No operation
1 (XORCALC) XOR calculator operation
This field is reserved for flash read request.

This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

Chained Message
When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.

This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.

Tag
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.

Flash Address
This field encodes the physical flash address of the page to be read for different planes.
8
3
0
eccCodeRateIndex
ECC Code Rate Index
This field specifies the ECC code rate index used for ECC encode and decode operations
An ECC code rate index of zero indicates a raw bulk data transfer
8
7:4
reserved
Reserved
8
15
8
maxIter
Max Iterations
This field specifies the maximum number of iterations to be completed before the LDPC decoder declares an uncorrectable ECC error.
A value of zero means 256 iterations.
The value of this field is ignored during raw bulk data transfers and ECC encode operations
8
23
16
LLR0
Log Likelihood Ratio for a Received Zero
This field contains the Log Likelihood Ratio (LLR) used by LDPC decode operations for a bit value of zero read from NAND.
The LLR is six bits in size. The value of the top two bits of this field is ignored.
The value of this field is ignored during raw bulk data transfers and ECC encode operations
8
31
24
LLR1
Log Likelihood Ratio for a Received One
This field contains the Log Likelihood Ratio (LLR) used by LDPC decode operations for a bit value of one read from NAND.
The LLR is six bits in size. The value of the top two bits of this field is ignored.
The value of this field is ignored during raw bulk data transfers and ECC encode operations
9
15
0
scramblerSeed
Scrambler Seed
This field contains a seed value used by the scrambler .
9
23
16
readRetry
Read Retry Option
This field contains the read retry option to be used during NAND read operation.
9
27
24
numPlane
Number Of Planes
This field indicates number of planes involved in current operation.
9
28
dfBuffOperation
Data Frame Buffer Operation
0 - No operation performed before or after flash operation
1 - Allocate/Release buffer after successful flash operation.
9
31
29
dfBuffType
Data Frame Buffer Type
This field is used to indicate preferred buffer types in BufferFree message requests issued by the Flash interface buffer manager to the buffer manager
10
23
0
pageReadTime
Page Read Time
This field specifies the page read time in units of Flash controller clock cycles
10
31
24
readHdrCount
Read Header Count
This field contains the number of read headers involved in current read operation
11
15
0
firstDFOffset
First Data Frame Offset
This field contains the first data frame buffer offset.
When data frame spanned two physical pages, first data frame buffer offset represents offset of the first data frame buffer to transfer the data.
11
31
16
dataFrameLength
Data Frame Length
This field contains the data frame length.
12
31
0
rawBuffer
Raw Buffer
This field contains raw buffer line address.
Raw buffer address is used When there is a ECC error, raw data (ECC chunk data) is transferred to the raw buffer if a raw buffer is given. Otherwise, raw data is dropped and never transferred to the CMU. A non-zero value indicates a raw buffer is given.
13
31
0
readHeader0
Read Header
This field contains read header.
14
31
0
dataFrameBuffer0
Data Frame Buffer 0
This field contains data frame buffer 0 line address associated with readHeader0
15
31
0
readMsgDW15
Read Message DWord 15
Depending on number of buffers in readHeaderx, this field contains another read header or data frame buffer line address

section.title: FlashWrite
section.p: This message is used to send single-plane or multi-plane flash page program requests to the flash interface. The size of message is limited to 16 DWORDs and the format of the first two DWORDs is fixed for HW use. If there's more than 16 DWORDs of information, FlashCont message will be used.

description.p: This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
Valid values for FlashChReq messages are zero through 253. Values outside this range are reserved.
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.
This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.
This field specifies the XOR calculator flow ID.
The value of this field is ignored when the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.
The XOR Calculator ID field is translated when processed by the XOR calculator. When received by a Flash channel processor, this field contains the XOR context ID.
Last Request of a XOR Calculator Flow ID Stripe
This field indicates whether this is the last request of a Flow ID stripe.

ul.li: 0 (NOTLAST) First or middle operation of a Flow ID stripe
1 (LAST) Last operation of a Flow ID stripe

description.p: The value of this field is ignored then the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.
whether a XOR calculator operation is perform as a side effect of request message processing.
This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.
This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.
This field encodes the physical flash address of the page to be written for different planes.
This field specifies the ECC code rate index used for ECC encode and decode operations
An ECC code rate index of zero indicates a raw bulk data transfer
This field contains a seed value used by the scrambler .
This field indicates number of planes involved in current operation.

ul.li: 0 - No operation performed before or after flash operation
1 - Allocate/Release buffer after successful flash operation.

description.p: This field is used to indicate preferred buffer types in BufferAlloc message requests issued by the Flash interface buffer manager to the buffer manager
This field specifies the page program time in units of Flash controller clock cycles
This field contains the number of write headers involved in current write operation
This field contains the first data frame buffer offset.
When data frame spanned two physical pages, first data frame buffer offset represents offset of the first data frame buffer to transfer the data.
This field contains the data frame length.
This field contains data frame buffer 0 line address associated with writeHeader0
Depending on number of buffers in writeHeaderx, this field contains another write header or data frame buffer line address
Depending on number of buffers in writeHeaderx, this field contains another write header or data frame buffer line address

section.title: FlashCont
section.p: This message is used for read and write commands to convey more than 16 DWORDs of information limited by the FlashRead and FlashWrite messages. This message contains more read/write header or read/write data frame buffer.

description.p: This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
Valid values for FlashChReq messages are zero through 253. Values outside this range are reserved.
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.
This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.
This field specifies the XOR calculator flow ID.
The value of this field is ignored when the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.
The XOR Calculator ID field is translated when processed by the XOR calculator. When received by a Flash channel processor, this field contains the XOR context ID.

note.p: This field is reserved for flash cont requests.

description.p: Last Request of a XOR Calculator Flow ID Stripe
This field indicates whether this is the last request of a Flow ID stripe.

ul.li: 0 (NOTLAST) First or middle operation of a Flow ID stripe
1 (LAST) Last operation of a Flow ID stripe

description.p: The value of this field is ignored then the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.

note.p: This field is reserved for flash cont requests.

description.p: This field encodes whether a XOR calculator operation is perform as a side effect of request message processing.

note.p: This field is reserved for flash cont requests.

description.p: This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.
This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
Depending on number of buffers in readHeaderX/WriteHeaderX, this field contain another read header/write header or data frame buffer line address.

section.title: FlashErase
section.p: This message is used to send single-plane or multi-plane flash block erase requests to the flash interface. The size of message is limited to 16 DWORDs and the format of the first two DWORDs is fixed for HW use.

description.p: This field encodes the request message type. The value of this field is microcode specific.
Valid values for FlashChReq messages are zero through 253. Values outside this range are reserved.
This field encodes the Flash channel queue associated with this message request.
This field encodes the Flash channel associated with this message request.
This field specifies the XOR calculator flow ID.
The value of this field is ignored when the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.
The XOR Calculator ID field is translated when processed by the XOR calculator. When received by a Flash channel processor, this field contains the XOR context ID.

note.p: This field is reserved for flash erase request.

description.p: Last Request of a XOR Calculator Flow ID Stripe
This field indicates whether this is the last request of a Flow ID stripe.

ul.li: 0 (NOTLAST) First or middle operation of a Flow ID stripe
1 (LAST) Last operation of a Flow ID stripe

description.p: The value of this field is ignored then the XORCalcOp field value is set to NOP.

note.p: This field is reserved for flash erase request.

description.p: This field encodes whether a XOR calculator operation is perform as a side effect of request message processing.

note.p: This field is reserved for flash erase request.

description.p: This field contains the node address of the next request message in the message chain. A value of zero in this field indicates that this is the last message of a message chain.

When this bit is set, the request message is part of a chained message and is not the last message in the message chain. The address of the next request message in the message chain is specified by the chMsgNodeAddr field.
This field specifies the index of Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.
This field encodes the physical flash address of the page to be erased.
This field indicates number of planes involved in current operation.
This field specifies the block erase time in units of Flash controller clock cycles.

note.p: Erase Polling time is fixed in Microcode.

section.title: FlashOpCpl
section.p: This message is used to notify flash operation completion, whether single-plane or multi-plane, from flash interface to the firmware. For flash read requests, when data buffers are allocated by the flash interface, it can only send two data buffer pointers in flashOpCpl message. If the firmware is reading more than two data frames data, and using auto-allocation buffer option, FlashOpCplCOnt is needed.

description.p: This field encodes the completion message type.
This field specifies the index of the Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field encodes the status of the operation:

This bit is set if the percentage of bits in the ECC Chunk prior to LDPC correction that had a value of one was greater than the threshold specified by the erased page ECC chunk threshold (ERASEDTH) field in the ECC Control (ECCCTL) register.

If the status field indicates completion without error, then this field contains the total number poll retries required before it was determined that the flash operation completed. In all other cases, the contents of this field are undefined.
A value of zero in this field indicates that no retries were required and that the Flash device indicated completion the first time it was polled.
This field contains opaque data that is passed from the request to the corresponding completion.
This field contains plane's read/write/erase error status. One bit per plane.
Total Number of ECC Bit Errors in Plane 0

If the completion is associated with a Flash read request and the status field indicates completion without error, then this field contains the total number of ECC bit errors that were detected in the flash page. In all other cases, the contents of this field are zero.
Total Number of ECC Bit Errors in Plane 1

If the completion is associated with a Flash read request and the status field indicates completion without error, then this field contains the total number of ECC bit errors that were detected in the flash page. In all other cases, the contents of this field are zero.
Total Number of ECC Bit Errors in Plane 2

If the completion is associated with a Flash read request and the status field indicates completion without error, then this field contains the total number of ECC bit errors that were detected in the flash page. In all other cases, the contents of this field are zero.
Total Number of ECC Bit Errors in Plane 3

If the completion is associated with a Flash read request and the status field indicates completion without error, then this field contains the total number of ECC bit errors that were detected in the flash page. In all other cases, the contents of this field are zero.

If an uncorrectable ECC error was detected in any ECC Chunk, UncErrBitVector contains a bit vector for each potential ECC Chunk. A bit in this vector is set if an uncorrectable error was detected in the corresponding ECC Chunk.

If an uncorrectable ECC error was detected in any ECC Chunk, UncErrBitVector contains a bit vector for each potential ECC Chunk. A bit in this vector is set if an uncorrectable error was detected in the corresponding ECC Chunk.

If an uncorrectable ECC error was detected in any ECC Chunk, UncErrBitVector contains a bit vector for each potential ECC Chunk. A bit in this vector is set if an uncorrectable error was detected in the corresponding ECC Chunk.

If an uncorrectable ECC error was detected in any ECC Chunk, UncErrBitVector contains a bit vector for each potential ECC Chunk. A bit in this vector is set if an uncorrectable error was detected in the corresponding ECC Chunk.
This field contains the controller memory line address that points to the start of data frame 0.
The memory line address is equal to the 37-bit controller memory byte address of the memory line shifted right six bits.
This field contains the controller memory line address that points to the start of data frame 1.
The memory line address is equal to the 37-bit controller memory byte address of the memory line shifted right six bits.

section.title: FlashOpCplCont
section.p: For flash read requests, when the data buffers are allocated by the flash interface, flashOpCplCont message is used to send remaining data frame buffer line address to the firmware.

description.p: This field encodes the completion message type.
This field specifies the index of the Flash completion outbound message queue to be used by this message.
This field encodes the status of the operation:
Data Buffer n Controller Memory Address
This field contains the controller memory line address that points to the start of data frame n.
The memory line address is equal to the 37-bit controller memory byte address of the memory line shifted right six bits.

section.title: FlashMemWrite
section.p: The FlashMemWrite message is used to initialize the I-RAM and D_RAM of enabled Flash Channel Processors. This message is processed normal even when the Message Network is disabled(MNDIS) at the Flash Channel Controller end.

description.p: This field must be set to a value of 255 in a flashMemWriterequest message.
Number of DWords contained in the message request
This field specifies the number of valid DWords in this message request. The values zero as well as 13 through 16 are reserved and causes the message to be discarded.

Each bit in this field corresponds to a flash channel processor (i.e., bit zero corresponds to flash channel processor zero, bit one corresponds to flash channel processor one, and son on). When a bit in this field set, the message request is sent to the corresponding Flash channel processor.
This field specifies the starting DWord address location in Flash Channel Processor address space (i.e.,D-Mem or I-Mem) where the data DWords contained in this message are written.
